Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a recognizable fish in a natural water habitat, such as a lake, river, pond, or ocean, and label these correctly.
The student can show where the fish gets what it needs to live, like using arrows to indicate water for swimming and breathing.
The student can include and label a few other plants or animals that might live in the same habitat as the fish, although not necessarily all possible species.
The student accurately illustrates and describes interactions between the fish and other living things, demonstrating an understanding of how they use resources to survive.
CANNOT: The student might occasionally omit some labels, such as specific plant names or detailed parts of the fish (may leave out gills or fins).
The student might not fully explain how the ecosystem is a complete, interdependent system (may not explicitly connect all parts, like plants providing oxygen).
The student might show a basic understanding of habitat resources but might not clearly depict niche interactions (e.g., predator-prey dynamics).
